title: Oil and Oil Filter Change

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Warning - General - Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil

Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil can lead to skin dryness, irritation and dermatitis. In addition, used engine oil contains potentially harmful contamination which can cause cancer. Wear suitable clothing and avoid skin contact.
The engine oil and filter must be replaced in accordance with scheduled maintenance requirements.
If the engine has recently been running, the engine oil will be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot oils may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, do not touch hot oil.
A new oil filter must be fitted each time the engine oil is replaced.
Not changing the filter will create an airlock and prevent oil pressure from being achieved and the oil pressure warning light will remain on.
Oil and oil filter change PB1; PJ1; PJZ
Warm up the engine thoroughly, and then stop the engine and secure the motorcycle in an upright position on level ground.
Remove the wire clip and detach the TSA shift force sensor from the gear change knuckle.
Release the fixings and remove the front sprocket outer cover.
Note the orientation of the wire guide for installation.
Note the routing of the harness and hoses through the wire guide for installation.
Detach the side stand switch connector from the oil filter cover.
Release the fixing and remove the engine oil filter cover and wire guide.
Place an oil pan beneath the engine.
Remove the oil drain plug and discard the sealing washer.

body.name: PB engine oil and filter B01165

body.body: Unscrew and remove the oil filter using service tool
. Dispose of the old oil filter in an environmentally friendly way.
After the oil has completely drained out, fit a new sealing washer to the drain plug. Fit and tighten the plug to
Always fill the engine with clean oil prior to fitting the new oil filter.
Fitting the new oil filter before filling the engine will create an air lock in the oil gallery and oil starvation.
Oil starvation will cause premature engine damage leading to engine failure.

Fill the engine with a 10W/40 or 10W/50 semi or fully synthetic motorcycle engine oil that meets specification API SH (or higher) and JASO MA, such as Castrol Power 1 Racing 4T 10W-40 (fully synthetic).
A new oil filter must be fitted each time the engine oil is replaced.
Not changing the filter will create an airlock and prevent oil pressure from being achieved and the oil pressure warning light will remain on.
Apply a smear of clean engine oil to the sealing ring of the new oil filter.
Fit the new oil filter and tighten to
Fit the oil filter cover with the wire guide in the same orientation noted for removal. Tighten the fixing to
Attach the side stand switch connector to the oil filter cover.
Route the harnesses and hoses through the wire guide as noted for removal.
Position the sprocket cover to the crankcase with the coolant expansion tank hose, fuel tank vent hoses and the oxygen sensor harness positioned as noted for removal.
Note the lower left hand fixing also secures the oil filter cover between the sprocket cover and crankcase.
Fit and tighten the fixings to
Fit the TSA shift force sensor upper ball socket to the gear change knuckle ball joint and secure with the wire clip.

Raising the engine speed above idle before the oil reaches all parts of the engine can cause engine damage or seizure. Only raise engine speed after running the engine for 30 seconds to allow the oil to circulate fully.
There are two conditions that will make the engine oil warning light either not illuminate or remain on.

If the engine is warm (coolant temperature above 65°C) with the engine running at idle, the oil warning light will not illuminate. If the engine speed is raised above 1,400 rpm the oil warning light will illuminate if a signal from the oil pressure switch is received for 1.5 seconds.
If the oil warning light illuminates, it will remain on until the ignition is switched off.
If the oil warning light illuminates, switch off the ignition. On restart the oil pressure warning light will not be illuminated if there is no signal from the oil pressure switch.
Start the engine and allow it to idle for a minimum of 30 seconds. Then raise the engine speed above 1,400 rpm for 5 seconds.

If the engine oil pressure is too low, the low oil pressure warning light will illuminate. If this light stays on when the engine is running, stop the engine immediately and investigate the cause. Running the engine with low oil pressure will cause engine damage.
Make sure that the low oil pressure warning light remains off and the oil pressure message is not visible in the instrument display screen.
Stop the engine and check the oil level, (see

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

Prolonged or repeated contact with engine oil can lead to skin dryness, irritation and dermatitis. In addition, used engine oil contains potentially harmful contamination which can cause cancer. Wear suitable clothing and avoid skin contact.

A new oil filter must be fitted each time the engine oil is replaced.
Not changing the filter will create an airlock and prevent oil pressure from being achieved and the oil pressure warning light will remain on.

. Dispose of the old oil filter in an environmentally friendly way.
After the oil has completely drained out, fit a new sealing washer to the drain plug. Fit and tighten the plug to
25 Nm
Always fill the engine with clean oil prior to fitting the new oil filter.
Fitting the new oil filter before filling the engine will create an air lock in the oil gallery and oil starvation.
Oil starvation will cause premature engine damage leading to engine failure.

Fill the engine with a 10W/40 or 10W/50 semi or fully synthetic motorcycle engine oil that meets specification API SH (or higher) and JASO MA, such as Castrol Power 1 Racing 4T 10W-40 (fully synthetic).
A new oil filter must be fitted each time the engine oil is replaced.
Not changing the filter will create an airlock and prevent oil pressure from being achieved and the oil pressure warning light will remain on.
Apply a smear of clean engine oil to the sealing ring of the new oil filter.
Fit the new oil filter and tighten to
10 Nm
using
T3880313 - Oil Filter Wrench
Fit the oil filter cover with the wire guide in the same orientation noted for removal. Tighten the fixing to
3 Nm
Attach the side stand switch connector to the oil filter cover.
Route the harnesses and hoses through the wire guide as noted for removal.

Note the lower left hand fixing also secures the oil filter cover between the sprocket cover and crankcase.
Fit and tighten the fixings to
10 Nm

Raising the engine speed above idle before the oil reaches all parts of the engine can cause engine damage or seizure. Only raise engine speed after running the engine for 30 seconds to allow the oil to circulate fully.
There are two conditions that will make the engine oil warning light either not illuminate or remain on.

If the engine is warm (coolant temperature above 65°C) with the engine running at idle, the oil warning light will not illuminate. If the engine speed is raised above 1,400 rpm the oil warning light will illuminate if a signal from the oil pressure switch is received for 1.5 seconds.
If the oil warning light illuminates, it will remain on until the ignition is switched off.
If the oil warning light illuminates, switch off the ignition. On restart the oil pressure warning light will not be illuminated if there is no signal from the oil pressure switch.
Start the engine and allow it to idle for a minimum of 30 seconds. Then raise the engine speed above 1,400 rpm for 5 seconds.

If the engine oil pressure is too low, the low oil pressure warning light will illuminate. If this light stays on when the engine is running, stop the engine immediately and investigate the cause. Running the engine with low oil pressure will cause engine damage.
Make sure that the low oil pressure warning light remains off and the oil pressure message is not visible in the instrument display screen.
Stop the engine and check the oil level, (see
Oil Level Inspection
). Adjust if necessary.
